article.description: Tashombe Riley scored 16 points, Eric Eaves added 15 and South Carolina State upended Maryland-Eastern Shore 62-58 on Saturday.
article.headline: South Carolina State beats Maryland-Eastern Shore 62-58
article.linkText: South Carolina State beats Maryland-Eastern Shore 62-58
article.story: PRINCESS ANNE, Md. -- Tashombe Riley scored 16 points, Eric Eaves added 15 and South Carolina State upended Maryland-Eastern Shore 62-58 on Saturday. Ed Stephens-who scored 10- hit a 3, and Eaves' pair of free throws with 2:21 remaining gave South Carolina State (15-12, 10-3 Mid-Eastern Athletic) the lead for good. Maryland-Eastern Shore (8-19, 5-7) raced to a quick 7-0 lead before being outscored 16-7 over the next 10 minutes. Greg Mortimer hit back-to-back 3s for the Bulldogs to give them their first lead of the game at 16-14, and went to intermission with a 32-25 lead. The Hawks battled back, starting the second half outscoring South Carolina State 19-12 in the first 10 minutes, and tied it at 44 on a jump shot by Devin Martin. Mark Blackmon hit a 3 to give the Hawks a 49-48 lead with 7:48 to play. Dominique Elliott-who scored 23 points-hit a jumper for UMES to make it 56-52 with 3:45 to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
